title: City’s police oversight agency is finally starting to subpoena Boston cops
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Boston's Office of Police Accountability and Transparency has issued subpoenas to nine Boston police officers to appear at a meeting.
The move comes after complaints of widespread non-cooperation by Boston Police Department employees with the oversight agency's investigations.
Failure of subpoenaed officers to appear may lead OPAT to file contempt proceedings to enforce compliance.

title: Third wheels are the best wheels
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Meredith Goldstein's Love Letters newsletter explores the benefits and misconceptions of third wheeling in relationships.
Experts Elaine Hoan and Jaimie Arona Krems discuss how couples may avoid inviting singles due to perception gaps.
Krems suggests couples could benefit socially by including singles, challenging assumptions of disinterest in third wheeling.

title: How losing their parents led two brothers to the Boston Marathon
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Brothers Connor and Collin Nally run the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Dana-Farber Cancer Institute and honor lost parents.
The Nally brothers' personal motivation stems from losing both parents and a fiancée's mother to cancer.
Their fundraising goal is $27,000, aiming to aid cancer research and support families facing similar losses.

title: After stage 3 blood cancer, Lynnfield woman will return for 7th Boston Marathon
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Allison Milford from Lynnfield will run her 7th Boston Marathon in 2026 to support the Boston Athletic Association.
Milford overcame stage 3 blood cancer and completed her first Boston Marathon in 2011 after finishing treatment in 2009.
She aims to raise funds for programs benefiting at-risk children by participating in marathons, highlighting resilience and community support.

title: DHS criticizes city councilor after chaotic ICE arrest in Roslindale
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston City Councilor Enrique Pepén criticized ICE after a chaotic arrest in Roslindale involving Jose Perez-Antonio.
DHS spokesperson labeled Perez-Antonio a 'serial criminal illegal alien' and criticized Pepén for his comments on the arrest.
Boston's Trust Act limits cooperation with ICE, which received 57 detainer requests ignored by local police in 2025.

title: Nice weather kicks off the holiday weekend, but will the next storm system be a hit or miss?
author: David Epstein
bullets: Pleasant weather is expected for Southern New England over the Presidents Day weekend, with temperatures in the mid-30s.
Saturday and Sunday will be mostly sunny, with mild temperatures and minimal wind; clouds are predicted to move in Monday.
A coastal storm might develop off the Carolinas by Monday, but predictions currently favor it missing Southern New England.

title: What K’Lavon Chaisson and Jaylinn Hawkins said about upcoming free agency
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: K'Lavon Chaisson and Jaylinn Hawkins will become free agents next month; both expressed interest in returning to the Patriots.
Chaisson had a breakout season with 7.5 sacks and tied for the team lead in tackles for loss with 10.
Hawkins hopes to return after posting a career-high four interceptions and 71 tackles with the Patriots this season.

title: A Mass. middle school basketball coach collapsed during a game. The opposing coach sprang into action.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Belmont coach Ian Haffer saved Waltham coach Ronnie Poirier with a defibrillator after a suspected heart attack.
Haffer, a medical doctor, administered CPR and two defibrillator shocks before paramedics took over.
Poirier is in the ICU recovering, with Belmont checking on the emotional well-being of affected students.

title: Another movie theater is shutting down in Massachusetts
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Showcase Cinema de Lux in Randolph, Massachusetts will close on March 1, ending its operations at the Mazzeo Drive location.
Owned by National Amusements, the property was bought for $4 million in 1997 and later developed into a theater.
The Randolph closure follows the shutdown of the Showcase Cinema at Patriot Place, now being renovated by Phoenix Theaters.

title: Giveaway: Enter to win tickets to a screening of ‘Midwinter Break’
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Love Letters offers 10 pairs of tickets for 'Midwinter Break' screening on Feb. 19 at AMC Boston Common.
To enter, send a relationship question to Love Letters by February 17 for a chance to win tickets.
The film, by Focus Features, is based on Bernard MacLaverty's novel about a couple's reflective trip to Amsterdam.
